procedures.description: Tympanoplasty is a surgical operation for the reconstruction of the eardrum (tympanic membrane) and/or the small bones of the middle ear. It is performed to repair perforations or other damage to the eardrum, or to correct hearing loss caused by defects in the middle ear.
procedures.shortDescription: Repair eardrum and middle ear bones to correct hearing loss or damage.

steps.shortDescription: Make an incision behind the ear to access the middle ear.
Remove damaged tissue from the middle ear.
Place a graft to repair the eardrum or bones of the middle ear.
Close the incision made behind the ear.

procedures.description: Fracture repair is a surgical procedure used to fix broken bones of the arm. It involves the use of metal rods, screws, or plates to hold the bone fragments together, allowing proper healing and restoration of function.

steps.shortDescription: Make an incision over the fracture to access the broken bone.
Realign the broken bones into their correct positions.
Attach metal hardware such as rods, screws, or plates to stabilize the fracture.
Close the incision made during the procedure.

procedures.description: Tendon repair is a surgical procedure used to repair torn or damaged tendons in the arm. It is commonly performed to restore function and stability to the affected joint.

steps.shortDescription: Make an incision to access the torn tendon.
Reattach the torn ends of the tendon using sutures or other fixation techniques.
Close the incision made during the procedure.

procedures.description: Arthroplasty is a surgical procedure involving the replacement of a knee joint with a prosthetic joint. It is commonly performed to relieve pain and restore function in patients with severe arthritis or joint damage.

steps.shortDescription: Make an incision to access the knee joint.
Remove damaged surfaces of the knee joint.
Insert the prosthetic knee joint.
Close the incision made during the procedure.

procedures.description: Anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) reconstruction is a surgical procedure aimed at reconstructing the ligament in the center of your knee with a new ligament. It is commonly performed to restore stability and function to the knee joint following ACL injury or rupture.

steps.shortDescription: Make an incision to access the knee joint.
Remove the damaged anterior cruciate ligament.
Place a graft to reconstruct the anterior cruciate ligament.
Close the incision made during the procedure.

procedures.description: Cataract surgery is a surgical procedure involving the removal of the lens of the eye that has developed an opacification, known as a cataract. It is commonly performed to restore vision in patients with cataracts, improving visual acuity and quality of life.

steps.description: Small incision made in the eye
steps.shortDescription: Make a small incision to access the eye.
Remove the clouded lens affected by the cataract.
Insert an artificial lens to replace the removed cataract.

procedures.description: LASIK (Laser-Assisted In Situ Keratomileusis) is a laser eye surgery used to correct refractive vision issues, such as nearsightedness, farsightedness, and astigmatism. It involves reshaping the cornea to improve the focusing power of the eye, reducing or eliminating the need for glasses or contact lenses.

steps.shortDescription: Create a flap in the cornea to access the underlying tissue.
Reshape the cornea using a laser to correct refractive errors.
Reposition the corneal flap back into place.
